Protest=X

$Ron Northey was thrown out at the plate, ending the inning; Cardinals manager Eddie Dyer protested the game because 3B umpire Beans Reardon had signaled that Northey's ball was a home run as the batter approached 3B; Northey slowed his pace when he thought he had a four-bagger and would have scored without the errant signal; the Cardinals used that as the basis of their protest; NL President Ford Frick later ruled in favor of the Cardinals declaring Northey's hit a home run; Frick did not order the teams to resume the game from this point, however, declaring the game a 3-3 tie due to the runs scored by the Dodgers in the bottom of the ninth; the play on Northey was 942 but with the out removed, the half inning only has two outs; the next play never happened and is inserted because we need three outs
